content.description: Unfortunately, this is the only line on the face due to surrounding interferences. There is some questionable loose rock in the upper part as well so tread carefully. The large flake in the center of the wall can be used in a variety of ways but it's anyone's guess how solidly it's attached. Nonetheless, this is an attractive and challenging problem.
content.location: The start is sort of a hybrid sit/stand due to the steep angle and the fact that the bottom edge of the boulder doesn't touch the ground. Start with the RH on a shallow sidepull pocket and the LH in a good 2 finger pocket. Bump up to a good pocket, then use the large flake to link to a good hueco up and left. Once the hueco is latched the topout is straightforward.

content.description: This block features a stark, steeply overhanging face. As the name implies it's well hidden in a tangle of trees made worse by the 2017 ice storm.
